paint

Class ECanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
        • paint.ECanvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CCanvas

    public class ECanvas
extends javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
    Extended version of JavaFX's canvas, this makes easy to draw.

        Method to draw a rectange on the canvas.
        Parameters:
        ix - initial X
        iy - initial Y
        cx - current X
        cy - current Y
        f - whether the shape is to be filled in or a frame (true for filled)

                     double cx,
                     int n,
                     boolean f)
        Method to draw a 'n' sided polygon on the canvas.
        Parameters:
        ic - A pair of the input coordinates
        cx - The current X value
        n - The number of sides
        f - whether the shape is to be filled in or a frame

      • getPolygonPoints

        public javafx.util.Pair<double[],double[]> getPolygonPoints(int n,
                                                            javafx.geometry.Point2D ic,
                                                            int cx)
        This method is a function that allows drawing on canvas,
        Parameters:
        n - An integer for the number of sides the polygon should have.
        ic - The initial mouse coordinates
        cx - The current X value
        Returns:
        A Pair of double Arrays, with the key corresponding to the X points, and the value corresponding to the Y points.

        Returns:
        An Image Object of the canvas.

      • getRegionAsImage

        public javafx.scene.image.Image getRegionAsImage(javafx.geometry.Point2D ic,
                                                 double cx,
                                                 double cy)
        This method returns the current selection as an Image.
        Parameters:
        ic - The initial mouse coordinates.
        cx - current X
        cy - current Y
        Returns:
        the subset of the current image enclosed by the selection

      • applyEffectToRegion

        public void applyEffectToRegion(javafx.geometry.Point2D ic,
                                double cx,
                                double cy,
                                javafx.scene.effect.Effect e)
        This method applies an effect to the current selection of the Image.
        Parameters:
        ic - The initial mouse coordinates.
        cx - current X
        cy - current Y
        e - the effect to apply.

      • rotateRegion

        public void rotateRegion(javafx.geometry.Point2D ic,
                         double cx,
                         double cy,
                         double deg)
        This method rotates the current selection by a the provided number of degrees
        Parameters:
        ic - the initial mouse coordinates
        cx - current X
        cy - current Y
        deg - the degrees to rotate the image by

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears out the canvas of any drawn image by drawing a 'null' image.

      • bucketFill

        public void bucketFill(javafx.geometry.Point2D ic,
                       javafx.scene.paint.Color targetCol,
                       javafx.scene.paint.Color replacementCol)
        This Method performs a recursive stack based bucket fill to the image using an epsilon value of 0.3.
        Parameters:
        ic - - the initial mouse coordinate
        targetCol - - the color at the initial coordinate
        replacementCol - - the color to replace targetCol
